work.name: Forschungszentrum Jülich, Germany
work.summary: Currently working as a research intern in the Applied Machine Learning (AML) group at the Brain and Behaviour Institute (INM-7). The focus is on exploring machine learning techniques in brain imaging data.

projects.name: Studying Synchronisation in Coupled Systems
projects.summary: Research focused on studying synchronization phenomena in coupled systems, with practical experiments that exhibit synchrony.
highlights: Design and implementation of tabletop experiments
Exploration of synchronization in various systems
projects.supervisor: Prof. Ramakrishna Ramaswamy, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi

projects.name: Probing Variation in Fermi Coupling Constant Using Supernova Ia Data
projects.summary: Investigation of the temporal variation of the Fermi Coupling Constant by analyzing light curves of Type Ia supernovae.
highlights: Exploration of fundamental constants in physics
projects.supervisor: Dr. Akshay Rana, St. Stephen’s College, Delhi

projects.name: Fast Radio Bursts (FRB) Classification Using Neuro-Evolutionary Techniques
projects.summary: Application of evolutionary neural networks (ENNs) to classify Fast Radio Bursts as part of a final year dissertation.
projects.supervisor: Dr. Geetanjali Sethi, St. Stephen’s College, Delhi

projects.name: Analysis of Neural Data Using Non-Linear Features and Neural Networks
projects.summary: Research focused on analyzing Electroencephalogram (EEG) data from epileptic and schizophrenic patients using various machine learning classifiers.
highlights: Classification using SVMs, KNNs, and CNNs
Application to neurological and psychiatric disorders

projects.name: A Novel Dual Polarized Disconne Antenna Design in the 18 - 40 MHz Range
projects.summary: Design and development of a novel dual-polarized antenna, awarded first prize in a national competition.

publications.name: Digital Fireflies: Coupled LEDs in Synchrony
publications.summary: This paper explores the synchronization of coupled LED systems, providing insights into how simple systems can exhibit complex behaviors like synchrony. The work is grounded in the study of nonlinear dynamics and chaos.

publications.name: Examining Temporal Variation of the Fermi Coupling Constant using SNe Ia Light Curves
publications.summary: The study investigates the temporal variation of the Fermi Coupling Constant by analyzing light curves from Type Ia supernovae, contributing to our understanding of fundamental constants in physics.

publications.name: A Novel Method for Schizophrenia Classification using Nonlinear Features and Neural Networks
publications.summary: This paper presents a new method for classifying schizophrenia using nonlinear features and neural networks, demonstrating the potential of machine learning techniques in medical diagnosis.
